skillTree.name: The Skewering Branch
skillTree.description: No hide nor armour can stand against the piercing fury of a Dryad or Tree Kin's savage limbs.

effects.description: Armour-piercing weapon damage: +3 for Dryads units
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +10 for Tree Kin units

skillTree.name: Skin of the Woods
skillTree.description: Hewn from the same forest that surrounds them, Tree Kin withstand attacks like the forest withstands the fury of the seasons.

effects.description: Ward save: 10% for Tree Kin units

skillTree.name: Dark Heart
skillTree.description: The wild beasts of the forest always sense the emotions of the Treemen, empathising with their pain over eons of loss.

effects.description: Armour-piercing weapon damage: +3 for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks and Giant Wolves units
Charge bonus: +6 for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks and Giant Wolves units
Speed: +5% for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks and Giant Wolves units
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +6 for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks and Giant Wolves units
Charge bonus: +12 for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks and Giant Wolves units
Speed: +10% for Cave Bats, Feral Manticore, Giant Spiders, Great Hawks and Giant Wolves units

skillTree.name: Verdant Growth
skillTree.description: Whether roused for war or retreated into the dreaming lands of sleep, the Treemen’s innate magic nurtures the forest and its lesser spirits.

effects.description: Casualty replenishment rate: +15% for Dryad, Tree Kin and Treeman units

skillTree.name: Immortality
skillTree.description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in battle, this Lord will be wounded instead

skillTree.name: Foe-Seeker
skillTree.description: From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.

skillTree.name: Endurance of the Oak
skillTree.description: Taking their cue from the forest itself, the Lord endures and overcomes all.

skillTree.name: Impenetrable Bark
skillTree.description: Using the forest itself as a shield, this Lord is protected by their devotion to Athel Loren.

skillTree.name: Tempered Rigour
skillTree.description: When to strike, when to block, when to dodge. These are all skills the warriors of Athel Loren must perfect.

skillTree.name: Violent Delights
skillTree.description: There is no greater thrill than to be in the midst of battle, slaughtering in the forest's name.

skillTree.name: Deadly Onslaught
skillTree.description: The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.

skillTree.name: Awakening of the Wood
skillTree.description: Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Awakening of the Wood"

skillTree.name: Life Bloom
skillTree.description: Even the simplest of spells can bring forth the full bloom of renewal, reinvigorating and healing the broken and bleeding.

skillTree.name: Earth Blood
skillTree.description: The Wizard draws wholesome energies from the soil, imbuing companions with the natural resilience of the earth.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Earth Blood"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Earth Blood Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Earth Blood Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Shield of Thorns
skillTree.description: Prickly gorse bursts from the ground around the caster's allies, protecting them from attack like a spiky, living shield.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Shield of Thorns"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Shield of Thorns Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Shield of Thorns Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Flesh to Stone
skillTree.description: This spell temporarily transforms allies' mortal flesh into unbreakable rock, increasing tenfold their resistance to attack.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flesh to Stone"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flesh to Stone Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Flesh to Stone Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Regrowth
skillTree.description: By speaking Druthandor's name the Wizard is able to heal allies' injuries much faster than by natural means.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Regrowth Upgraded"

skillTree.name: The Dwellers Below
skillTree.description: This spell causes gnarled, fibrous hands to emerge from beneath the ground, dragging the foe to a claustrophobic, suffocating end.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Dwellers Below"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Dwellers Below Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Dwellers Below Upgraded"

skillTree.name: Earthing
skillTree.description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.

skillTree.name: Magical Reserves
skillTree.description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

skillTree.name: [Hidden] Awakening of the Wood
skillTree.description: Trees live for thousands of years and have very long memories. When called to fight, centuries of pent-up wrath are unleashed.

skillTree.name: Call of the Woods
skillTree.description: The Lord embodies the forest; as a result of this, their warriors feel a greater call to defend it.

skillTree.name: Howl of the Forest
skillTree.description: The Lord charges their troops to fight for Athel Loren, for their very souls are tethered to its fate.

skillTree.name: Greater Aspect of the Oak
skillTree.description: Those who adopt the oak’s warlike aspect typically stand on the front line, such is the sheer structural strength of its genus.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Dryad, Tree Kin and Treeman units

skillTree.name: Greater Aspect of the Birch
skillTree.description: Wherever winter retreats, the birch is amongst the first to sprout forth, for its vibrance is its greatest strength.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +15 for Dryads, Tree Kin and Treeman units

skillTree.name: Greater Aspect of the Willow
skillTree.description: Once the willow’s warlike aspect is adopted, branches and leaves droop and overlap, absorbing anything that may cause harm.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% for Dryad, Tree Kin and Treeman units

skillTree.name: Inspiring Presence
skillTree.description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

skillTree.name: Piercing Thorns
skillTree.description: Every blade and barbed branch will eventually find its mark – when they do, the forest’s infinite anger is truly felt.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
Melee attack: +6 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
Weapon strength: +6% for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
Melee attack: +8 for Eternal Guard and Dryads units
Weapon strength: +12% for Eternal Guard and Dryads units

skillTree.name: Bolts of the Forest
skillTree.description: Let each bolt be imbued with the strength of Kurnous, and bring death to all his enemies.

effects.description: Missile strength: +6% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
Reload time reduction: +5% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
Missile strength: +9% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units
Missile strength: +12% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units

skillTree.name: Striking Branches
skillTree.description: Let the enemy feel the fury of nature, embodied in these warriors as they crash through their lines.

effects.description: Speed: +6% for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
Speed: +9% for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
Charge bonus: +6 for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
Speed: +12% for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units
Charge bonus: +12 for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats and Sisters of the Thorn units

skillTree.name: Swinging Boughs
skillTree.description: The warrior strikes with the strength of a swinging tree limb; few can stand against such strength.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
Melee attack: +6 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
Melee defence: +4 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
Melee attack: +8 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units
Melee defence: +8 for Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units

skillTree.name: Ancient Bark
skillTree.description: Centuries upon centuries of existence have given these ancient Tree Spirits a natural armour, mitigating any physical blows dealt against them.

effects.description: Armour: +6 for Tree Kin and Treeman units
Physical resistance: 5% for Tree Kin and Treeman units
Armour: +9 for Tree Kin and Treeman units
Physical resistance: 10% for Tree Kin and Treeman units
Armour: +12 for Tree Kin and Treeman units

skillTree.name: Wings of the Forest
skillTree.description: Not all of the forest's guardians are rooted to the ground – flying enemies will always be in danger from the woodland's airborne protectors.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +6% for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
Weapon strength: +9% for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
Charge bonus: +6 for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
Reload time reduction: +5% for Hawk Riders units
Weapon strength: +12% for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
Charge bonus: +12 for Hawk Riders, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Hawk Riders units

skillTree.name: Shield of the Forest
skillTree.description: Armour as hard as the ancient bark of the forest, it repels blows that would rend others asunder.

effects.description: Physical resistance: 15% for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
Armour: +12 for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)
Melee defence: +5 for Eternal Guard, Dryads, Wardancers, Bladesingers and Wildwood Rangers units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.name: Nature's Quiver
skillTree.description: What is a ranger without an arrow? Who can be the best without dozens?

effects.description: Missile resistance: 15% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
Ammunition: +20% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)
Range: +10% for Glade Guard, Deepwood Scouts, and Waywatchers units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.name: Swift & Sturdy
skillTree.description: Moving like the wind, whistling past tree branches, the riders of the forest hunt any who would do harm to the place they call home.

effects.description: Melee defence: +5 Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
Weapon strength: +12% Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
Charge bonus: +12 for Glade Riders, Wild Riders, Great Stag Knights, Zoats, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)
Missile strength: +12% for Glade Riders, Sisters of the Thorn and Hawk Riders units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.name: The Forest's Roar
skillTree.description: All of Athel Loren shouts with a fury as old as the ages, and the enemy knows its power.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 15% for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
Melee attack: +5 for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)
Melee defence: +5 for Tree Kin, Treeman, Great Eagle, and Forest Dragon units (Rank 7 and above)

skillTree.name: Ever-Reaching Tendrils
skillTree.description: The denizens of the forest will travel many miles to see those who would threaten Athel Loren put to rout.

skillTree.name: Wonders of the Forest
skillTree.description: Athel Loren provides for its deserving children, with wondrous boons gifted in recognition of their many endeavours.

skillTree.name: Nature's Salve
skillTree.description: The Worldroots provide succour for their children, purging the forests of any corrupting infestation.

skillTree.name: Obscuring Canopy
skillTree.description: The magics of the woods obscure and connive, able to turn enemy blades away from their targets.

skillTree.name: Growth of the Forest
skillTree.description: The forest provides for its warriors, rehabilitating and regenerating wounds suffered in its defence.

skillTree.name: Open Branches
skillTree.description: From all corners of the forest, they come to defend their homes.

skillTree.name: Lightning Strike
skillTree.description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.name: Swiftfingers
skillTree.description: The dead do not want for material possessions, yet the living may yet find value in them…

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.name: Perenniality
skillTree.description: Like the forest itself, the warriors of Athel Loren ebb and flow and regenerate with the passing of time.

skillTree.name: Quartermaster
skillTree.description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.

skillTree.name: Home Amongst the Boughs
skillTree.description: The forest-dwellers draw from the strength of Kurnous to fight ever harder, and be ever stronger.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.name: Blight of Terrors
backgroundSkills.description: Mirthfully looming out from their host, Terrors take on their most fearsome aspect to dampen the spirits of their horrified prey.

backgroundSkills.name: Muster of Malevolents
backgroundSkills.description: Unleashed upon a foe, these aggressive manifestations of the forest are utilised for their needle-like arrows that inflict painful wounds from afar.

backgroundSkills.name: Lamentation of Despairs
backgroundSkills.description: The Despairs are among the most feared Spites within Athel Loren, their arrival always foretelling imminent death.

ui_effects.description: ➖ Strikes any combatants in its path

backgroundSkills.name: Annoyance of Netlings
backgroundSkills.description: Scurrying over their host with feverish abandon, Netlings snag the weapons of enemies that come too close with webs of magical filaments.

backgroundSkills.name: Befuddlement of Mischiefs
backgroundSkills.description: The staring eyes and tattered wings of tiny, glowing Elves befuddle enemy minds, sending them into a sleep-like trance.

backgroundSkills.name: Cluster of Radiants
backgroundSkills.description: Radiants are sponges for magical energy, manifesting as little more than blurred shapes of pure light that beckon the Winds to their host.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: +2 for all enemy spells

backgroundSkills.name: Murder of Spites
backgroundSkills.description: Hiding in their hosts' hollows are fiendish forms, ready to strike out at any who draw near.

backgroundSkills.name: Pageant of Shrikes
backgroundSkills.description: Shrikes take on various frightening forms, moving like quicksilver to target the eyes, and even enter foes’ bodies to attack their very minds.

backgroundSkills.name: Resplendence of Luminescents
backgroundSkills.description: Bounding from branch to bow, the Luminescents’ magical spoors alight upon allies’ weapons to bestow a minor but lethal enchantment.
